skill.name: Security Gate
skill.description: Verify security considerations were addressed before shipping. Issues result in WARNINGS that strongly recommend fixing.
skill.summary: Verify security considerations were addressed before shipping. Issues result in WARNINGS that strong...
skill.author: DanielPodolsky

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing security guidelines and checklists. It has no executable code, network calls, or file system access beyond reading its own documentation file.

content.value_statement: Security vulnerabilities often slip through code reviews unnoticed. This gate provides systematic security checks to catch common issues like SQL injection, XSS, and authorization flaws before they reach production.
actual_capabilities: Provides security review checklists for code
Asks targeted questions about input validation
Checks for proper authentication and authorization
limitations: Does not replace professional security audits

use_cases.title: Pre-deployment Security Checks
use_cases.description: Run security gate before merging pull requests to catch vulnerabilities early in development cycle.

use_cases.title: Security Code Review Guide
use_cases.description: Use structured questions to ensure all security aspects are reviewed during code reviews.

use_cases.title: Learn Security Best Practices
use_cases.description: Understand common security vulnerabilities and how to prevent them through practical examples.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Security Review
prompt_templates.prompt: I'm building a login form. Run the security gate to check for common vulnerabilities I should address.

prompt_templates.title: API Security Check
prompt_templates.prompt: I have a REST API with user endpoints. Use the security gate to review authentication and data access patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Full Application Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a complete security review of my Node.js application using all security gate questions and checklists.

prompt_templates.title: Database Security
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my SQL queries and database access patterns for injection vulnerabilities and proper authorization.

output_examples.input: Review my user authentication system for security issues
output: I found 2 security considerations to address:
Risk: Brute force attacks on login endpoint
Question: "What stops an attacker from trying thousands of password combinations?"
Suggestion: "Consider implementing proper session expiration and secure cookie flags"

best_practices: Run security gate on every pull request before merging
Address all CRITICAL warnings before deployment
Use the socratic questions to guide team discussions
Keep security checklists updated with new threats
anti_patterns: Assuming security is only for production systems
Relying solely on automated tools without human review

faq.question: What security issues does this gate check for?
faq.answer: It checks for SQL injection, XSS, authorization flaws, insecure data exposure, hardcoded secrets, and other common vulnerabilities.

faq.question: Does this replace a professional security audit?
faq.answer: No, it's a pre-deployment check for common issues. Critical applications still need professional security testing.

faq.question: How long does a security review take?
faq.answer: Typically 5-15 minutes depending on code complexity. Critical findings may require longer discussion.

faq.question: Can I customize the security questions?
faq.answer: The gate provides standard questions, but you can add project-specific security requirements as needed.

faq.question: What if the gate finds too many issues?
faq.answer: Focus on CRITICAL and HIGH risk issues first. Fix MEDIUM and LOW issues in subsequent iterations.

faq.question: Is this suitable for all programming languages?
faq.answer: The principles apply universally, though examples focus on web technologies. Adapt questions for your stack.
